alert.note: Alert for Rota (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 28 at 5:01PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: .Rainfall is diminishing, however saturated soil means flooding could still be possible today. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Guam and Rota. * WHEN...Until 4 AM ChST Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The outer bands of Tropical Depression Khanun (06W) will likely rotate through Guam and Rota tonight, bringing one last round of scattered locally heavy showers. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
